title: Publisher Rocket review: New keywords and categories tool to sell books on KDP

tactics.name: Category Research with Publisher Rocket
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket's category search to identify high-potential niches with lower competition and sales thresholds.
steps: Search keywords related to your genre
Analyze category sales data and rankings
Compare sales thresholds for top positions
caveats: Sustaining top rankings requires consistent sales
source_quotes: it would take 346 a day to stay at number one

tactics.name: Category Performance Analysis
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to evaluate category sales data and visibility thresholds
steps: Analyze average page count and age
source_quotes: I want to stay visible in the top 100 of all of my categories for as long as possible

tactics.name: Category Optimization
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to identify high-traffic categories for keyword-based books by analyzing competition and sales data.
steps: Search for keywords (e.g., 'vampire') and filter top-selling categories
Check BSR and sales thresholds for category relevance
Validate book fit with category audience and cover design
caveats: Foreign language categories may have smaller audiences
source_quotes: if I found any that were a good fit it's probably worth putting in some of those low ranking ones

tactics.name: Publisher Rocket Keyword Research
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to optimize book categories and keywords for better visibility on KDP
steps: Research categories and keywords with Publisher Rocket
Set up book details using tool insights
Apply findings during first-time book publishing
caveats: Tool may not account for real-time market shifts
source_quotes: you won't have access to all of this information and all the data

heuristics.name: Top 100 Ranking Strategy
heuristics.condition: If a category's top 100 rank requires fewer sales than top 10, prioritize it
source_quotes: it's less difficult to stay in the top 10

heuristics.name: Review Count Threshold
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize categories with lower competition
source_quotes: I wouldn't be surprised if it misses some there are some other tools you can use to find more hidden categories

heuristics.name: Low-Competition Targeting
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews < 200, prioritize categories with low competition
source_quotes: these are all the ones that would only take one sale to rank in that category

heuristics.name: Low Review Boost
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews are less than 200, prioritize tools that provide structured data
source_quotes: you could do all this stuff for free um poking around Amazon but you won't really know

claims.statement: KDP allows up to 10 category selections with Amazon displaying top 2
source_quotes: you can choose up to two categories but you can also request eight more

claims.statement: Average page count in some categories reaches 601 due to box sets
source_quotes: this is 601 that's pretty crazy for a book but this is probably a lot of box sets

claims.statement: Amazon's algorithm prioritizes category alignment for visibility
source_quotes: it's not only about getting the visibility... you also want to make sure you're in the right category

claims.statement: Publisher Rocket is a one-time purchase tool for KDP authors
source_quotes: Publisher Rocket is a page tool I think it's about a hundred dollars but it's not a monthly fee

niche_patterns.description: Target underserved niches with specific constraints for differentiation
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Leverages low review counts and niche category opportunities
